originalTitle: Heavy gunfire and blasts heard near airport in Niger's capital
title: Heavy gunfire and blasts heard near airport in Niger's capital
content: The airport houses an air force base and is about 10km (six miles) from the presidential place.

originalTitle: Flights to northern Ethiopia cancelled as fears mount of renewed conflict
title: Flights to northern Ethiopia cancelled as fears mount of renewed conflict
content: Passengers received a text message about the cancellation of flights, citing "unforeseen circumstances".

originalTitle: Senegal boss Thiaw banned after Afcon final chaos
title: Senegal boss Thiaw banned after Afcon final chaos
content: Senegal manager Pape Thiaw his banned for five games after the chaotic scenes during the Africa Cup of Nations final against Morocco.

originalTitle: White House ‘Border Czar’ announces shift in Minnesota tactics
title: White House ‘Border Czar’ announces shift in Minnesota tactics
content: White House “Border Czar” Tom Homan said federal immigration agents will conduct “targeted” operations in Minnesota.

originalTitle: German star latest to take aim at Trump ahead of FIFA World Cup in US
title: German star latest to take aim at Trump ahead of FIFA World Cup in US
content: Bayern Munich midfielder and German international Leon Goretzka says European teams are emboldened heading to World Cup.

originalTitle: Key questions about US military build-up near Iran
title: Key questions about US military build-up near Iran
content: Trump is building up a military force in the Middle East, saying the US is ready to strike Iran.

originalTitle: EU adds Iran's Revolutionary Guards to terrorist list
title: EU adds Iran's Revolutionary Guards to terrorist list
content: EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas says the move is a response to Tehran's deadly crackdown on protesters.

originalTitle: What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios
title: What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios
content: From regime change to retaliation, the BBC's Frank Gardner outlines possible outcomes of US strikes on Iran.

originalTitle: Nicki Minaj calls herself Trump's 'number one fan' and shows off gold card visa
title: Nicki Minaj calls herself Trump's 'number one fan' and shows off gold card visa
content: The Trinidadian-American rapper held hands on stage with the US President, amid ICE protests.

originalTitle: Palace agree £50m Strand Larsen deal as Forest chase Mateta
title: Palace agree £50m Strand Larsen deal as Forest chase Mateta
content: Crystal Palace agree a deal in principle worth in the region of £50m to sign Wolves striker Jorgen Strand Larsen.

content: Why former England and Chelsea coach Steve Holland could be the key appointment in new boss Michael Carrick's coaching team at Manchester United.
